column4: I'm a bit confused as to why entering a command in a terminal works, but using the same shortcut in one of the drop-down menus doesn't do anything ?
What is acting oddly on the menu, but fine in cli?
methinks you need to do: ruby /home/user/.rubyripper/rubyripper_gtk2.rb
:: I tried that as well, same effect
Did you try it with quotes?
:: quotes don't change it
as in ruby "/home/user/etc" or "ruby /home/user/etc" I'm not sure which one does it, but one of them should...
:: the first has no effect, the second gives an error as the file doesn't exist
Quotes change how it's read when you click. Like for me, to run WoW from a shortcut, I have to tell it: wine "/home/me/WoW/WoW.exe" --opengl
:: yeh, I know, everything inside the quotes is read as one parameter
Hmm...so you have ruby installed, but it's not working by calling on ruby...hmmm...
:: I'll enumerate that it does work from a command-line
:: my nautilus is non-functional, that might have something to do with it, I'm not sure
Hmmm....and you don't need to do a ./ to run it, or even a "run" command?
:: executing from a command-line via '/home/user/...' or 'ruby /home/user/...' both work fine
Because genereally, I can't get ANYTHING to run cli without telling it ./ or run or sh or python etc.
Okay, that's farqed up. ruby "/home/user/.." should work fine then.
:: yeh, it doesn't
Okay, here's a weird attempt to try...
So what happened when you used ALT+F2 and ran it?
:: it doesn't do anything visible
:: how can I make the terminal stay open if I've run it via alt-f2 ?
Find the issue?
